banner.text: Please plug in a Motion sensor for this challenge

Let's make a very special button that makes a ridiculous noise ðŸ“¢!
First, open the Control tray.
Drag the block onto your code space...
...and drag the block onto your code space.
Open the draw tray again... (we're going to be using it a lot!).
Drag the block onto your code space...
Now, change to a nice pale color for your background, like: #FFCCCB, #FFCD95, #FFFFCA, #95FF95, #CCCBFF
Nice choice! Now open the draw tray.
Drag the block onto your code space.
Drag the block onto your code space...
Let's choose the best shade of red for your button, maybe #ff6666?
...and drag the block onto your code space.
Drag the block onto your code space...
Drag the block onto your code space.
Choose a grey color, like #666666, for the button edges.
...and drag the block onto your code space.
Drag the block onto your code space...
Drag the block onto your code space.
Choose another grey color, like #c0c0c0, for your table.
Drag the block onto your code space...
Now let's use the Motion Sensor to make the button respond to your hand movements!
Drag the block onto your code space...

Use the Sensor data to control the lerp block.
Open the Motion tray.
Drag the block onto your code space.
Move your hand over the sensor... can you see the button moving between the two numbers in the lerp block?

Finally, let's add some sound!
Open the Motion tray again.
Drag the block onto your code space...

Let's trigger the sound when your hand is closest to the Sensor.
Change 1 to 5.

Now let's add a speaker to the app.
Open the parts drawer on the right side of the screen.

tooltips.text: Click on Speaker to add it to your app

banner.text: Drag the block onto your code space...
Drag the block onto your code space.

Change Bell to any sound you like...
try as many you want to.

Try putting your hand over the sensor and pushing down slowly...
PRRRRRP!!!! Great job!
Next, why not try changing the sound your button makes?
